revised_title: The Mesodermic Origin and Fate of the Mesectoderm in Petromyzon
tldr: The author examines the mesodermic origin and fate of the mesectoderm in Petromyzon, a type of lamprey. They discuss previous research on the topic and present their own observations, concluding that the mesectoderm arises from the ectoderm and differentiates into nerve cells and connective tissue. The author also addresses the role of placodes in the development of the nervous system and the formation of gill slits.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
